column4: There's a USB flash drive. that is now read-only. I need to make it NOT read only. any idea how I can fix this? trying to do this in linux
mount /media/something -O remount
What is the filesystem on the flash drive?
dmesg | tail -10  have anything to say about why it is read-only?
dmesg  prints out kernel messages. Mostly hardware related stuff. | tail -10  says give me the last 10 lines
pastebin
yeah, I see sdh
pastebin  the output of mount
run the mount command in a terminal window, and put the output on pastebin
let me show you an example
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/me835472
You shoul dhave something about the flash drive
just type the command  mount in a terminal window, no command arguments
I would try unmounting it, and running fsck.vfat against it
fsck.vfat /dev/sdh
Do you need the data on this flash drive, or could you just format it?
so right click and format it
Have a windows machine around?
try formatting on windows
There is no physical switch on it?
brand of drive?
http://download.cnet.com/OnBelay/3000-2094_4-10260671.html  Try this program in Windows.
Apparently you can format a flash drive in a funny way that causes to be ro.
no, never had that problem
